intro: Sclerostylis macrophylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its woody stem and evergreen leaves. The plant attaches itself to the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients from them. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Sclerostylis macrophylla plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insect species and birds.
